description: The Directorate initiates Operation Reset in response to growing unrest, detaining key Innovator and Harmonist members, banning analog communications, and launching raids on known activists distributing coded signals.
Oksana Lintz uncovers Halden’s hidden shutdown protocol while scrutinizing BCI automation logs. She quietly weighs the enormous risk of activating it as the Directorate escalates crackdowns.
The Council forcibly recalibrates the BCI, erasing protest-linked Tribunal-era scores and restoring privileges to trusted citizens, aiming to erase evidence of dissent.
Oksana Lintz makes her choice: she secretly triggers Halden’s kill-switch, initiating a hard shutdown designed to scramble central civic systems and BCI controls.

Stenograd plunges into sudden blackout; BCI functions collapse, transit halts, and Council control falters. As rumors of sabotage and cover for the hunted spread, flashes of organized resistance emerge amid the chaos.
